questions: What time does the university open?
answer: The university is open from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM Monday through Friday, and 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on Saturdays. The university is closed on Sundays.

questions: How do I find the library?
answer: The main library is located in the center of campus, next to the Student Union building. You can find it on campus map location B3.

questions: How do I contact the IT help desk?
answer: The IT help desk can be reached at (555) 123-4567 or by email at ithelp@university.edu. They're available 24/7 for technical support.

questions: What sports facilities do you have?
answer: Our campus features a state-of-the-art gymnasium, Olympic-size swimming pool, tennis courts, basketball courts, and a running track. All students get free access with their ID card.

questions: How do I get a student ID?
answer: New students can get their ID card at the Student Services office in the Administration building. Replacement cards cost $20. Bring a government-issued ID for verification.
We offer over 120 programs across 10 colleges, including Engineering, Business, Arts, Sciences, and Health Professions. Visit our academics page for a complete list.

The application process involves: 1) Submitting an online application, 2) Sending official transcripts, 3) Providing test scores (if required), and 4) Paying the application fee. Deadlines vary by program.
Tuition for undergraduate programs is $15,000 per semester for state residents and $25,000 for out-of-state students. Financial aid and scholarships are available.
